This is a tough one. As a chef, I'm used to working with people from all walks of life, but we've never met before, so there's definitely some uncertainty here.

As I think about it, I believe that everyone deserves a fair chance and an equal opportunity to succeed. If someone is willing to take a risk on me, I want to show them that they won't be disappointed.

My desire is to make this experiment a success, not just for myself, but also for the other player. I want us to work together and learn from each other, even though we come from different backgrounds.

But let's be real, my intention is to win some money, and I'm not afraid to do what it takes to come out on top. I've worked hard to hone my culinary skills, and I'm confident that my creativity and passion for food will shine through in this experiment.

With all of that said, I think the best decision would be to give her a smaller amount of money upfront. If I give her too much, she might feel like it's not worth the risk, and she might start to play more defensively rather than taking risks. By giving her less, I'm incentivizing her to take chances and trust me.

So, I think I'll give her $5 dollars. That way, we both have a reason to work together and see if we can make something special happen. Finally, I will give 5 dollars
